name: Buffalo Park / Nate Avery Trail
description: Buffalo Park is Flagstaff's premier family-friendly hiking destination. The Nate Avery Trail is a 2-mile loop with spectacular views of the San Francisco Peaks. The wide, well-maintained path is perfect for strollers and young hikers. Dogs are welcome on leash. The open meadow setting makes it easy to keep an eye on kids.
shortDescription: Easy 2-mile loop with stunning mountain views, perfect for strollers and young hikers.
topPickReason: The most accessible and scenic family trail in Flagstaff with views of the San Francisco Peaks.
tips: Go early for the best parking and cooler temperatures
The loop can be shortened if little legs get tired
Watch for prairie dogs in the meadow
Bring layers - it can be windy

name: Sandy's Canyon Trail
description: Sandy's Canyon offers a moderate hiking experience through beautiful forest and into a scenic canyon. The trail descends into the canyon, offering unique rock formations and wildlife viewing opportunities. While the descent is easy, remember that you'll need to hike back up!
shortDescription: Moderate forest trail descending into a scenic canyon with unique rock formations.
tips: The trail goes down first - save energy for the way back
Bring plenty of water
Good spot for wildlife watching
Can be combined with other Lake Mary area trails
trailheadParking: Small lot off Lake Mary Road

name: Griffith's Spring Trail
description: Griffith's Spring is a lovely, short trail that leads to a small spring in the forest. The trail winds through ponderosa pines and offers a peaceful hiking experience. It's an excellent introduction to hiking for younger children with its gentle terrain and interesting destination.
shortDescription: Short, easy trail through pine forest leading to a peaceful spring.
address: Off Route 66, West of Flagstaff, AZ
tips: Great first hiking trail for young children
The spring may be dry in late summer
Watch for butterflies in spring and summer
Combine with a Route 66 adventure

name: Aspen Loop Trail
description: Located at the Arizona Snowbowl base area, the Aspen Loop Trail offers a beautiful forest walk among aspens and conifers. In fall, the golden aspen leaves create a spectacular display. The trail is well-maintained and offers mountain views throughout.
shortDescription: Beautiful forest loop through aspen groves with stunning fall colors.
address: Arizona Snowbowl, 9300 N Snowbowl Rd, Flagstaff, AZ 86001
tips: Visit in late September/early October for peak fall colors
Higher elevation means cooler temperatures
Can get crowded on fall weekends
Combine with a scenic drive up Snowbowl Road

name: Picture Canyon Natural & Cultural Preserve
description: Picture Canyon is a unique preserve featuring ancient petroglyphs, sinkholes, and diverse wildlife habitats. The easy trails wind through a volcanic landscape with interpretive signs explaining the area's cultural and natural history. It's a great educational hiking experience for families.
shortDescription: Easy trails through volcanic landscape with ancient petroglyphs and sinkholes.
tips: Look but don't touch the petroglyphs
Several short loop options available
Great for a geology lesson
Bring binoculars for bird watching

name: Frances Short Pond
description: Frances Short Pond offers an accessible loop trail around a peaceful pond with fishing opportunities. The paved path is perfect for strollers and wheelchairs. Kids love watching for fish, ducks, and other wildlife. It's connected to the urban trail system for longer adventures.
shortDescription: Paved accessible loop around a pond with fishing and wildlife viewing.
tips: Bring bread to feed the ducks (in moderation)
Great for learning to ride bikes
Fishing requires an Arizona license for adults
Connects to longer trail system
